case_vignette: A 63-year-old African American man presents to the emergency department with edema over his face and difficulty breathing. Past medical history is significant for hypertension and dyslipidemia. He recently began lisinopril and atorvastatin several weeks ago. His father died at 80 years from complications of a stroke and his mother lives in a nursing home. His blood pressure is 135/92 mm Hg, the heart rate is 101/min, the respiratory rate is 21/min, the temperature is 32.0°C (98.6°F). Clinical pathology results suggest a normal C1 esterase inhibitor level.
question: Of the following options, which is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
My face is swollen and I'm having trouble breathing.
Have you had any difficulty breathing before?
No, this difficulty breathing is a new problem for me.
Have you had any recent injuries or accidents?
No, I haven't had any recent injuries or accidents.
Have you had any allergies or asthma in the past?
No, I haven't had allergies or asthma in the past.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or diet?
No, I haven't had any recent changes in my weight or diet.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns?
No, I haven't had any changes in my sleep patterns recently.
Have you had any recent changes in your stress levels?
No, I haven't experienced any recent changes in my stress levels.
Have you had any recent changes in your exercise routine?
No, I haven't made any recent changes to my exercise routine.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication?
Yes, I recently started taking lisinopril and atorvastatin several weeks ago.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history?
You can't really have "changes" in your family history since it's about past events, but nothing new has happened lately in my family's health history.
Final Diagnosis: Angioedema.
